page.title: 03 PRIMARY SCHOOLS IN THE AREA
page.content: Brook Lodge is a primary school of 96 infants and 166 juniors.It is a modern building with excellent amenities e.g. good gym and sports equipment.There is no set timetable,but maths,science, humanities and scripture are covered. Many after-school societies exist.Also the school produces a play annually. The pupils go on an adventure holiday in the fourth year. The village school at Crank is 126 years old.It has 41 pupils,but 10 years ago it had 120.Most of the people in the village do not wish to see the school close.The opening of a new school in Rainford contributed to this decline.Although some Rainford children come to Crank,some Crank children go to Rainford.The school is the focus of life in Crank,providing an individual education,but needs a staff of eleven to keep it running.
